level.text: The following weight classifications for kickboxers are hereby established:
Flyweight, one hundred twelve pounds (112 lbs.) or under;
Bantamweight; over one hundred twelve pounds (112 lbs.) but not more than one hundred and twenty-five pounds (125 lbs.);
Super Lightweight, over one hundred twenty-five pounds (125 lbs.) but not more than one forty-five pounds (145 lbs.);
Lightweight, over one hundred thirty-four pounds (134 lbs.) but not more than one hundred forty-five pounds (145 lbs.);
Welterweight, over one hundred forty-five pounds (145 lbs.) but not more than one hundred fifty-eight pounds (158 lbs.);
Middleweight, over one hundred fifty-eight pounds (158 lbs.) but not more than one hundred seventy pounds (170 lbs.);
Light heavy weight, over one hundred seventy pounds (170 lbs.) but not more than one hundred eighty-four pounds (184 lbs.);
Heavyweight, over one hundred eighty-four pounds (184 lbs.) but not more than two hundred twenty-one (221 lbs.) pounds; and
Super heavy weight, over two hundred twenty-one pounds (221 lbs.).

The Commission may further recognize subcategories of the categories established in this section according to the rules of the association or federation under whose auspices a championship contest is held.
The following weight spread is permissible for matchmaking in kickboxing events within each weight classification:
Flyweight, no limit;
Bantamweight, not more than four pounds (4 lbs.);
Super Lightweight, not more than five pounds (5 lbs.);
Lightweight, not more than six pounds (6 lbs.);
Welterweight, not more than seven pounds (7 lbs.);
Middleweight, not more than eight pounds (8 lbs.);
Light heavyweight, not more than nine pounds (9 lbs.);
Heavyweight, no limit; and
Super Heavyweight, no limit.
The Commission may waive the requirements of ยง 2307.3 for good cause.
